data.data: WE STRIVE TO GIVE YOU THE BEST
ESS focus is directed to process vessels demanding high levels of finishing through to technology led equipment packages
lib/images/pageimages/img1.jpg
WE STRIVE TO GIVE YOU THE BEST

ESS Corp is a proud manufacture of ASME pressurized filter vessels that can use bags filters, cartridge filters, strainers and filters with permanent media including self-cleaning filter vessel. We produce filter vessels as standalone units as well as automated, packaged filtration systems on the skid with controls. Our standard filter vessels are produced from commonly used materials like Carbon and Stainless Steel. Vessels are also made of exotic materials like Hastelloy in various grades, Titanium, Carpenter 20, and are all available upon request. ESS is capable of designing custom vessels as per client need and follow industry best practices for design, fabrication and commissioning. Apart from pressure vessels fabrication, we fabricate in- house structural fabrication of frames and platforms, pipe welding, rolling and machined parts.
ESS is proud to own more 500+ CRN components registered in province of Ontario and Alberta on its name that are used for making pressurized components.

We can execute projects from specification to fabrication drawings to ITP. ESS conforms to all the relevant codes that includes ASME pressure vessel code, ASME piping code, NBA accreditation, CRN, CSA and R stamps for repairs and alterations and CRNs
The list of certificates that ESS has and used for production of pressure vessels been mentioned below:
ASME
National Board
TSSA

ESS focus is directed to process vessels demanding high levels of finishing through to technology led equipment packages

ESS provides filters for filtration vessels used worldwide that includes bags filters, cartridge filters, strainers and filters with permanent media including media for multi vessel self-cleaning systems for cooling water that do not use wedge wire or incorporate any mechanical rotating components. Our screen technology allows for continuous washing and is ideal for the removal or Zebra Mussel larvae and other "fines" in the 20-100 micron range. For the convenience of our clients, we stock some finished units and spare parts, as well as consumables, required for everyday use of our products.
lib/images/pageimages/gasfiler.JPG
Contact us today for spare parts for your vessels and for selection of filters for your filter vessel.

content.data: Dry, coalescing, separator. Variety of materials, micron ratings, sizes and efficiencies.

ESS EFG Series Gas Filter Separator elements are designed to replace Peco, King Tool, Peerless, Facet and others. The direction of flow is outside to in. 3.5”, 4.5” and 5.5” diameters are available in lengths up to 72”. Nominal micron ratings of 10, 5, 1, 0.5, and 0.3 are available
ESS EFG Series elements also provide excellent dry gas filtration.
Standard element construction includes: Molded fiberglass media designed to efficiently coalesce free liquids for second stage removal while delivering high solids holding capacity
Plated steel end caps and cores which are mechanically joined to ensure the integrity of the element. A cotton outer cover to protect the element and the operator during installation.

ESS EPM Series Gas Particulate Filter elements are designed to replace Peco, King Tool, Peerless, Pall, and other manufacturers’ original elements. The direction of Flow is outside to in. A wide variety of medias and configurations are available in micron ratings as low as beta 5000 at 1 micron.
ESS EPM Series gas elements offer high solids capacities and resistance to liquids.

Standard element construction includes: Polypropylene, Polyester, Micro-Fiberglass, or Cellulose Synthetic media packs bonded to plated carbon steel end caps. These medias are also available with stainless steel hardware using plastisol or epoxy potting compounds. erusserplaitnereffidlaitiniwolrofdetaelperaskcapaideM s and maximum service life.
Note: Operating limits are for standard construction and may be affected by the use of alternative materials for ancillary components.
Carbon bed, Carbon Canister, Pottasium Permangate, Zeolite, Anthracite coal. Process design assistance available to determine best solution for specific contaminant removal.

Hydrosil International Lid. introduces a major breakthrough in oxidation of acid gases, fumes and odors. Spectrum HS-600, a unique molecular sieve impregnated with potassium permanganate, was created in our laboratories to oxidize gaseous pollutints such as hydrogen sulfide, sulfur dioxide, formaldehyde, ethylene, mercaptans, and various aldehydes and alcohols. Elective in air dryers, scrubber tunks, compressor intakes, chaus systems, computer rooms, general HVAC applications, and fresh fruit, vegetable and flower storage & transportation, Spectrum ILS 600 oxidizes contaminants more efficiently and offers longer service life than competitive products
Tough on the Competition. Tougher on Gas.
Spectrum HIS-600 beats competitive products two ways. First, Spectrum HS-600 has more active ingredient. And second, Spectrum HS 600 doesn't dust.

Spectrum HS-600 provides more active ingredient -- 80% more! As a direct result, Spectrum HS-600 offers a longer senice life, a lower contaminant removal cost, and a significant labor savings In addition, when dusting occurs in competitive products, up to 5% of the active ingredient is lost. Furthermore, dusting puts a tremendous strain on the rest of the pollution control system and causes a hazard to the worker including irritation to the eyes and skin.
The Best of Both, HS-600 with Activated Carbon.

There are situations where providing either adsorbent properties or reactivity chemistry alone are not enough. For example, in the air stream, carbon can absorb the higher molecular weight hydrocarbons. but a does nothing to lower weight hydrocarbons or acid gases. Spectrum XB-17 sohes this problem by providing boch adsorbent properties and reactive chemistry. A 50/50 blend by volume of its 600 and 60%. CIC activated carbon, the carbon in Spectrum XB-17 adsorbs the higher molecular weights, while the IS-G00 oidies the acid yases and lower molecular weight hydrocarbons.
The Lowest Cost Oxidation Media is also Easy to Handle.

Spectrum HS-600 and XB-17 are available in easy to handle one cubic foot cartons, pails, drums or super sacks. It should be stored in its original container and kept tightly sealed to keep it from going to work. Spectrum HS-600 presents no health hazard when shipped, stored, and handled correctly. Please refer to our Material Safety Data Sheet for more information,
Panels, Trays, Modules, Cells and Scrubbers.

Hydrosil International Ltd. has a complete line of replacement and original equipment panels, trays, modules, cells and scrubbers. They are available in coated cold roll, galvanized or stainless steel. Call us for solutions to your gas phase problems.
Please contact Hydrosil International Ltd. or your Local Distributor,

to successful water treatment and filtration is selecting the right combination of media and hardware. For treatment of hydrocarbons, heavy metals, and other organic contaminants, the optimal solution is efficient oil and water separation followed by the HS-200 series. Because HS-200 series can adsorb up to 70% of its  in hydrocarbons, its life inside a still bed canister is much longer than that of other process media such as granular activated carbon.

content.data: a modified Zeolite provider setting new standards in economical water treatment, including treatment of processed water and wastewater. Hydrosil's corporate headquarters anc manufacturing facilities are located in Elgin, IL. With over 16 years of filtration experience, we specialize in our own Zeolite based organoclay products called HS-200.

Zeolite is the base of our filtration media. Zeolite belongs to a family of naturally occurring volcanic minerals with unique physical and chemical characteristics. Generally speaking, natural zeolites are hydrated aluminosilicates. They consist of an open, three-dimensional cage-like structure and a vast network of open channels extending throughout. Loosely bound, positively charged atoms called cations are attached at the junctures of the negatively charged aluminosilicate lattice structure. Zeolite has a crystalline structure (similar to a honeycomb) consisting of a network of interconnected tunnels and cages. Zeolite has a high specific surface area; it's rigid framework eliminates shrinking and swelling. Perhaps the most commercially valuable and dynamic property of zeolite is its cation exchange capacity. The most common exchangeable cations found in zeolite molecules are ammonia, sodium, calcium, potassium, and magnesium, many which are desirable in numerous biological and industrial processes. The ability to release beneficial elements while capturing and binding other, often less desirable, materials makes zeolite an ideal media for selective adsorption of certain elements and compounds from soil, water and air.

The cornerstone of Hydrosil International's success is the HS-200 series, the future of Zeolite based organoclays. Our proprietary modification process transforms high-grade Zeolite into a powerful, selective water treatment adsorbent that bonds with hydrocarbons, organics and other contaminants upon contact, locking them inside its molecular structure. Hydrosil’s Contaminant Encapsulation Technology yields a granular filtration media capable of adsorping approximately 70% of its weight in hydrocarbons. Extensive application use and field testing of the HS-200 series, analyzed by independent laboratories, has demonstrated removal of a wide range of contaminants to nondetectable levels. The resulting discharge water meets or exceeds typical regulatory requirements.
HS-200 series has been used against a wide array of industrial waste streams:
HS-250 a blend of HS-200 and 8x30 Anthracite Coal

data: Contains 66% more active ingredient per cubic foot than activated clays on the market

content.data: HS-250-AC a blend of HS-200 and 6x12 Virgin Activated Carbon

data: This blend is the best of both worlds with the added benefits of Virgin Activated Carbon

content.data: HS-270 a blend of HS-200 and 8x30 Anthracite Coal

data: Was created to be a | to | replacement for Organoclays/ Activated Clays on the market that have Swelling issues

content.data: ESS coal based activated carbon has approximately1150 sq meters per gram while lignite carbon, For example, has approximately 650 sq meters per gram.In a canister containing 1 cubic foot of carbon that means that the lignite based canister, with 24 pounds, would have about 7 million square meters. The ESS Corp. coal based canister at 31 pounds delivers about 16.1 million square meters, more than double that of the lignite equivalent.

According to the manufacturer’s published data, lignite carbon has an average pore size of 28—30 angstroms while coal based carbon has an average pore size of 23—25 angstroms. While most carbon is used in water treatment, the job of these carbon canisters is to remove long chain hydrocarbons with a mol weight in excess of 225. In this application ESS Corp’s coal based carbon will retain 240 milligrams per gram of carbon compared to 120 milligrams per gram for the lignite based canister.

By combining the weight factor in paragraph one with the capacity per gram in paragraph two, the coal based canister has a capacity advantage of 2.6:1 In an effort to reduce costs, many manufacturers have begun to use regenerated carbon in place of the virgin carbon that was previously the industry standard. The regeneration of activated carbon does not return it to it’s original capacity. Losses depend on the original use and regeneration method. For these reasons, ESS Corp. does not use regenerated carbon and does not recommend it’s use

Factors affecting carbon performance include temperature and contact time in addition to the type of carbon and the target contaminant. Operating temperatures exceeding 150OF reduce carbon capacity in hydrocarbon capture to levels that make their application practically ineffective. Similarly, high flows and the resulting reduced contact time reduce the ability of carbon to capture and retain contaminants and can cause abrasion within the bed. The carbon filter should be protected upstream and down by adequate particulate filtration to prevent fouling of the bed and to prevent any carbon fines from entering the system. In a properly configured system, the carbon filter should not develop any significant differential pressure over time.

ESS Corp Vertical Flow Activated Carbon Canisters increase fluid contact by eliminating the potential bypass in using the relatively thin bed available in a radial flow configuration. ESS Corp. EVF 1120 and 1122 canisters outlast the radial flow design by 45%.
Ess Corp Radial Flow Activated Carbon Canisters  present a greater superficial area to the process fluid, lowering velocity to better deal with high solids contamination.

Ess Corp ctivated Carbon is specially selected to maximize performance in gas processing applications where the target contaminant is long chain hydrocarbon molecules. Used in all ESS Corp. Carbon Canisters, it is also available in bulk form, in100 lb bags and 1000 lb super sacks.
Meltblown, string wound, pleated, resin bonded. Variety of sizes, materials, micron ratings, and end cap configurations to accommodate most applications.
P1, P2, P3, P4 & custom. Polypropylene and Polyester Felt in 1 to 200 micron. Other available upon request. Variety of flange/ring styles and special options available.

data.data: ESS can also make range of filter housing from vent filter to single round of various high and multiple round filters. ESS filter housing are CRN rated and can be designed in T-style or Inline style.

Singles and multi-round housings available for industry standard as well as for custom cartridges. Multivessel systems with piping, valves and instrumentation. Pressure ratings to 5000 PSI, ASME Code Stamp, CRN and NACE Compliance. Numerous closure options and custom designs. Material include Carbon Steel, 304 and 316 Stainless Steel and alloys such as Alloy 20 and Hastelloy C-276.

Filter housings designed for elements that filter water and other liquids and vapors from compressed gas streams. Liquids are collected in a sump and drained. Coalescing elements are also effective in filtering particulate though not their intended use. Typical uses are compressed natural gas and compressed air. Pressure ratings to 5000 PSI, ASME code stamp, CRN and NACE compliance available. Numerous closure options and custom designs. Materials of construction include carbon steel, 304 & 316 SS and various alloys such as Alloy 20 & Hastelloy C-276.
lib/images/pageimages/coalescing.png

Filter housings designed such that a single housing will filter particulate and liquid from compressed gas streams. Typically they employ either dry gas or coalescing elements and some secondary stage for liquid separation like demister/mesh pads or twister pipes. Liquids are collected in a sump and drained. Typical uses are compressed natural gas and other hydrocarbon gases. Pressure ratings to 5000 PSI, ASME code stamp, CRN and NACE compliance available. Numerous closure options and custom designs. Materials of construction include carbon steel, 304 & 316 SS and various alloys such as Alloy 20 & Hastelloy C-276.
lib/images/pageimages/gasfilter1.jpg
lib/images/pageimages/charcoalfilter.jpg

content.data: Filter housings designed to house activated Carbon canisters. Typically used in amine sweetening systems to remove long chain hydrocarbons from lean glycol prior to being pumped into the contactor. Pressure ratings to 5000 PSI, ASME code stamp, CRN and NACE compliance available. Numerous closure options and custom designs. Materials of construction include carbon steel, 304 & 316 SS and various alloys such as Alloy 20 & Hastelloy C-276.

Filter housings designed to house activated carbon granular media . Typical uses are in water/waste water treatment and in amine sweetening systems. Pre and post bed filtration required in most cases to prevent "fouling" of the activated carbon bed and to prevent carbon particles from migrating downstream. Pressure ratings to 5000 PSI, ASME code stamp, CRN and NACE compliance available. Numerous closure options and custom designs. Materials of construction include carbon steel, 304 & 316 SS and various alloys such as Alloy 20 & Hastelloy C-276.

data.data: ESS Corp. Fabricated Strainers provide coarser filtration for removing dirt, debris, and particulates from pipeline. They provide a great first stage filtration before utilizing finer filtration elements.
https://www.youtube.com/embed/odw_BHUIkhI
Resolves issue with frequent changeover of filters and clogging of filters reducing low manpower requirement. Alternate to costly centrifugation process.

Simple to use plug and play Nanofiltration system can integrate with any Nanofilter selected for the process. The automation module can also integrate with depth filtration module (pre and post) and can control the associated depth filter with same module by modulation pressure across filter.

ESS’s Nanofiltration system has system components includes holding tanks, pump with VFD, pressure transmitter(s), automated Inlet valves, a nanofilter connection, PLC control and HMI. The Nanofiltration System shall be able to:

data: a. receive and pump different process inputs (process intermediate, buffers etc.)
b. connect to all buffer supplying process liquid to the system.
c. connect with containers which feed the process intermediates into the nanofiltration system
d. allow for the collection of the nanofiltrate via connection to a nanofiltrate holding tank
e. be cleaned and stored in-place.

data.data: ESS’s Nanofiltration system shall be capable of operating in at least two operational modes with capability of recipe preparation:
Constant Flow:

In constant flow operation mode, pump rpm is prime parameter that need to be controlled as shown in figure 1 by adjusting the pump speed and the automated inlet/outlet automated valves based on the control scheme between the PLC, VFD, pressure sensors, and automated valves.  In practice, the limiting factor to constant rpm operation is the maximum pressure differential of the filter membrane.  Over time the pressure will rise to match constant rpm and as the filter fouls and pump stops at maximum pressure. A filter replacement may become necessary when the maximum filter operating pressure has been reached.
Constant Pressure:

In constant pressure operation mode, pressure is prime parameter that need to be controlled as shown in figure 2 by adjusting the pump speed and the automated inlet/outlet automated valves based on the control scheme between the PLC, VFD, pressure sensors, and automated valves.  In practice, the limiting factor to constant pressure operation is the minimum flow rate.  Over time, as filter fouls the flow rate will decay to maintain constant pressure by reducing pump VFD settings. When flow decay reaches a predetermined minimum flow rate, the pressure is allowed to rise to reach Pmax and pump stops at Pmax. A filter replacement may become necessary when the maximum filter operating pressure has been reached.
Contact us today for our Nanofiltration system and module

ESS TFF skid is designed to be used with any manufacturers TFF holder or Cassette. ESS provides all piping, instrumentations, valves, mounting frames and supports, and other pre-wired system on the skid. Our piping scheme and automation program helps to operate TFF system for concentration and diafiltration in 2 modes as described below
Batch Mode
Concentration is done in batch and cycle of diafiltration is required pre- or post-concentration.
Continuous Mode

Also, referred as Constant Volume Diafiltration which helps to main the fluid volume during dia-filtration. The fluid can be concentrated pre – or post concentration. Continuous mode requires used of 2 pumps to manage equal flow between permeate outflow and diafiltration buffer input.
The specification of ESS TFF system are:

data: SS316L holder and piping (SS304 available on demand); <20 Ra or Electropolished Surface finish with smooth welds
Inline Temperature Transmitter with digital display
Sanitary pump for concentration and diafiltration
Flowmeter with local display or on HMI.
Inline Conductivity meter with local display or on HMI.
Recirculation loop for mixing chemical with option of Electric Heater in SS enclosure (washdown duty or NEMA rated) to maintain temperature inline.
304 SS frame with large casters with small footprint for mobility (if required)
Space for putting dosing pump on skid for formulation application (dosing pump optional)
100% Baroscopic, Passivation, FAT, SAT and turnover package
Diaphragm, Gasket and O-rings – EPDM, Teflon, Viton, etc

data.data: lib/images/pageimages/tffskid.png
Resolves issue with frequent changeover of filters and clogging of filters reducing low manpower requirement. Alternate to costly centrifugation process.
Dual Stage TFF system

Are you struggling with your process where volume of process reduces significantly? Our dual stage TFF system can solve this problem where need for concentration is high and volume handling become a challenge. The processes that faces these challenges are Formulations, or process with very low yield.
Contact ESS immediately to know more about Dual Stage TFF system
